item.description:
Let's meetup at Sally O'Brien's in Somerville's Union Square to hear a fantastic singer, songwriter and guitarist, Les Sampou.  Les plays with some twang and a honky-tonk attitude -- in short, roots music -- Americana.

Les' most recent CD, "Lonesomeville", is a great showcase for Les' talents, full of songs about good people poorly matched, intense longing, mournful laments and risking heartache.

It's life's soundtrack, wrenched from the soul.   We like it.

But don't take my word for it -- here's what the Boston Globe said about "Lonesomeville":

"On her long-awaited fifth album, 'Lonesomeville,' Les Sampou soars over a bracing set of sly, lived-in songs about mismatched lives, hard goodbyes, and honky tonk heartbreak. With a tough and tender voice that can be every bit as stinging or sultry as her slide guitar, Sampou deftly mixes bluesy soul with country twang and down-to-earth storytelling. All of which makes 'Lonesomeville' not such a bad place to be after all -- especially if she's playing there."

You can check out samples from "Lonesomeville" on her website and you can also see Les on YouTube.

Details:

  • There's no cover charge for this show.

  • It's Somerville, so parking can be a pain.

    Allow extra time to find a space if you're driving.

  • I'll be there at about 5:30 p.m.

    As noted above, I'll hang at the bar and I'll also email my cell # to all Yes and Maybe RSVPers a couple of hours before the show.

  • This is a joint meetup with the Cambridge-Somerville Live Music and Mass Blues, Brews and BBQ groups.

See you at Sally's.
item.how_to_find_us: I look like my profile picture. I'll be hanging at the bar and I'll also email my cell # to all Yes and Maybe RSVPers on the afternoon of the show.
item.name: Les Sampou Band @ Sally O'Brien's
